p: Back to the Yemeni situation. Yemen has six central public health laboratories in the major cities of Sana’a, Aden, Mukalla, Taiz, Hodeida and Ibb. Four of these (those in Sana’a, Aden, Taiz and Mukalla) have the capacity of COVID-19 testing with RT-PCR under supervision of WHO. The latter has made reagents for 6700 RT-PCR tests available, and provided laboratory staff with technical training and standard of procedures [ 9]. This means Yemen is almost entirely dependent on a resource-limited setting supported by WHO which, in the best-case scenario, only allows testing a small number of highly suspected cases.
